name: Kunpeng Liu 0001
content: HomeSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationKunpeng LiuAssistant ProfessorSchool of ComputingClemson UniversityEmail: kunpenl@clemson.eduGoogle ScholarDr. Kunpeng Liu is an Assistant Professor in the School of Computing at Clemson University. Before that, he was an Assistant Professor at Portland State University. He received his Ph.D. degree from the Department of Computer Science, University of Central Florida, Orlando, FL. He received both an M.E. degree and a B.E. degree from the Department of Automation, University of Science and Technology of China (USTC), Hefei.He has broad interests in data-centric AI (DCAI), large language models (LLMs), and reinforcement learning (RL), with application to big data problems, including automated feature engineering, effective LLM reasoning, efficient LLM fine-tuning, and spatiotemporal user behavior analysis. He has published more than 80 papers in refereed journals and conference proceedings. He serves as AC/SPC/PC for various conferences, including ICML, ACL, ICLR, NeurIPS, KDD, ICDM, SDM, WWW, CIKM, IJCAI, and AAAI. He has co-organized one tutorial and five workshops on DCAI. He is the Social Media Co-Chair for ICDM 2025, Financial Chair of IEEE ICKG 2024, and Registration Co-Chair of IEEE BigData 2024. He is a recipient of the Best Paper Candidate Awards from IEEE ICDM 2021, CIKM 2025, and ICDM 2025. He is a recipient of the NSF CRII Award.News11/2025 Invited as an Area Chair for ICML 2026.11/2025 One paper was accepted by KDD 2026.11/2025 Jinghan Zhang won the Female Student Award in Data Science at ICDM 2025. Only two female students have received the honor this year.
